Want to see around you at all times? 360° Vision for 25 Points. Want it cheaper? Give it a few Limitations.

objects.title: Genre System: Real Time Strategy - RPG
objects.text:
This System Package causes your System to shift from an RPG into that of an RTS with RPG elements. You start out as a commander unit with your own Faction. If you recruit someone into your group/party/organization/etc, they're added to your roster of units, and they gain a HUD of their own along with the ability to chat amongst members of the group. Any additional systems, flaws or existing systems you've access to you have the option of allowing group members to use, although flaws will always be applied. Any orders you give them is displayed on their HUD as both objectives and arrows/highlights to guide the way. Each unit has their own Attributes and Skills, and the ability to train them to gain higher levels.

You gain a [Camera] as well, one that allows you to see the area within 250 ft of a group/party/faction member, as well as said camera coming with a Threat Spectrum to highlight enemies, allies and everything in-between through it. It can absolutely be used for spying. You gain the Pause Function and Time Speed systems on top of everything else.

objects.title: Genre System: Real Time Strategy Alt. - Commander
objects.text: Instead of having other real people take the place of members in your Faction, you now have a separate pocket dimension that allows you to undergo Campaigns: Battles where you combat System-summoned enemies like one would in a classic RTS match/campaign level, sometimes with special objectives. You gain the ability to establish a Base and Summon your own soldiers here, who by default are a modern army in your favorite colors. When you've completed a Campaign's level you gain great rewards, loot and the ability to add defeated enemies into your list of Faction Summons, as well as the ability to save your Campaign's progress for later. While outside of this RTS dimension, you can summon your own troops into your reality's location, although the only way to gain more is to use the Campaign System.

objects.title: Genre System: First Person Shooter
objects.text:
Maybe you want something more boomer? The First Person Shooter Package does as it says, and shifts the Game from an RPG into a First Person Shooter. To start out with, you now have experience with most weapons, including firearms, which includes how to load, unload, fire and turn safe any weapon. Weapons in your possession don't degrade and in fact are always in tip-top working condition no matter how bad they look. Interestingly any opponents you take down with a melee weapon are always either incapacitated in some form, or killed, and always only whenever you desire.

You gain a Stealth System that makes you utterly silent and hard to notice so long as you make an effort to be, as well as a HUD that keeps track of your HP, Armor and Ammo. Your Inventory can keep an infinite supply of ammunition so long as you pick it up, and the ammo appears in your hand whenever you're reloading. As well, you'll find that just about any area can have secret collectibles, with each collected granting you a fitting ability or item. And you'll find that if you jump and angle yourself in a specific motion, you can "bunnyhop" at a pretty fast speed. Any other movement "glitches" you can think about might apply as well. Look to movement shooters for inspiration!

objects.title: Genre System: Simulator
objects.text: You'll find buying property and real world items to be much easier and quicker, the deed for such or said item in question appearing instantly where you want it and the cost instantly deducting from your System's wallet. You'll also find the building up of property or the creation of objects happening much faster than it otherwise should. Build a house in over two days, or a skyscraper taking a floor a day for each floor you want. If you pick a Profession (Class) like House Builder, Mayor, or Pilot, you'll find you now have enough skill at such to be decent at the job, with learning at the job/training accelerating your gains. You can gain loans from System-provided sources at pretty friendly rates of interest if you need to gain some startup capital, and if you're doing any kind of work related to your Profession you'll find your UI helping to assist you with it.

objects.title: Genre System: Platformer
objects.text: You gain a few perks, changing your system into a Platformer a la Mario, Sonic, etc. For one, you gain extra jumping height, at least 3-5 times your height now. Another is that you no longer have a height where you can't land safely, so long as you do so on your feet. A new System is introduced for you: Collectibles of some kind now appear around the world, although only you + Party/Guild members can see them. If you get hit by something that would otherwise hurt you while carrying these collectibles, you'll instead find yourself invincible for a few seconds while your held collectibles scatter, disappearing if you don't grab them quickly enough. Lastly, you now find physical traversal-based skills level much more quickly & easily, like running, jumping, or climbing.

objects.title: Genre System: Dating Simulator
objects.text: Feeling love in the air? Now you can mark or have the System target people that you want to court. People marked or Targeted for you in this way can be found in a new Relationship System, which has a relationship meter to measure how much they’re interested in you, as well as important information on them to know if you'd truly want to court them. It especially has great info on giving Targets gifts, based on what you'd want to grab and what to avoid like the plague. You'll now also find your System gives dialogue options during important moments with Date Targets, favoring ones that aid in moving the relationship however you wish it to. The Dating Simulator System also has a Gift Shop function, with stuff related to targets you’ve interacted with. You can do small Quests for Targets that can give you money to spend into this Gift Shop.

objects.title: Genre System: Roguelike
objects.text:
Most importantly through picking this Genre System, you can now never die permanently. However, whenever you are killed you instead find yourself back to the point in time when you gained your System, sans whatever gains you'd earned before dying.

As a bonus, you can shift reality so that from your perspective you're playing a Traditional Roguelike, with ASCII graphics and a turn-based system. You will always be able to swap.

defaultRowText: This is a row, and inside of it, you can place choices. On both rows and choices Requirements can be placed, which will block a row from being viewed, or make the player unable to select a choice, depending on either Point-types or the Ids of other choices. Point-types can be made in Features then Manage Points. Hovering over buttons will explain what they do. The Design of the project can be changed in 'Modify Design' at the side navigation bar, and private styling for each row can be turned on in the rows Settings. Default text like this can be turned off in Features -> Manage Defaults.
defaultChoiceText: This is a Choice, and inside of it, you can place images and text. Scores can be added to it, and have Point-types attached. Addons can be added underneath the image and text. In the Functions at the bottom of the choice, there is an array of different things that can be done. Default text like this can be turned off in Features then Manage Defaults.
